title: Gmail messages pointing at incorrect inbox message
content:
As of a few months ago I've experienced a few recently arrived gmail messages that point to a very old email message that no longer resides in my inbox. This occurs sporadically with no obvious pattern and once the misdirected pointer is present it remains -in spite of deleting previous emails, compacting, etc. If I access the email via a browser they render correctly. I'm using Thunderbird 128.3.3esr (64-bit). Any ideas why this might be happening? 

   Thanks
creator: tlylezim

title: setting up email on thunderbird
content: how do i set up my email foz62@optusnet.com.au on Thunderbird
creator: foz62

title: I have import the gmail(mbox)to thunderbird but cannot see the email even it appear 9 emails in the inbox
content:
Dear Team,

I have backup the gmail - emails and suspended the account. While wanna check whether my emails are properly back up or not i have downloaded thunderbird(KR Ver) and added "Import ExportToolsNG" and from inbox i have done right button click and imported mbox and i can see there is unread emails (9 emails) in the inbox.

however, even i click the inbox it keeps appear no message found and cannot see any details which 9 unread emails remain as same.

why this is happening? What step do i have missed? Please check and let me know;.


Thanks, inji
creator: inji1

title: Nebula Thunderbird 128 Calendar stops responding
content:
Recently upgraded Thunderbird from v91.13.1_win64 to Nebula v128... current install is 128.3.3esr (64-bit)

Everything upgraded just fine except for my local calendars. From Thunderbird, if I click on the Calendar tab, the calendar month shows up in the tab, but it is blank... Then Thunderbird stops responding & never recovers.

The *.sqlite files seem to be available in the calendar-data directory.

Any thoughts on how to get my local calendars back ??? thx...
creator: timeye

title: Issue with Thunderbird in showing e-mails (1 line string)
content:
Hello,

I have a very very strange behaviour in Thunderbird. For SOME e-mails, the next does not appear and also the message information (like the To:, From:, they also don't appear.

Can you please help me? It only happens in this Thunderbird instance.

Kind regards, Nikos
creator: charitonick

title: Problemi di visualizzazione mail
content:
Buongiorno, sto avendo dei problemi di visualizzazione di alcune e-mail su Thunderbird (ver 128.3.3esr 64bit) dove ho configurato varie caselle email IMAP con quasi tutte lo stesso provider. Con una visualizzazione impostata su verticale le email selezionate nel riquadro a sinistra non corrispondono con l'anteprima visualizzata a destra mescolando varie informazioni (mittente,oggetto,body,allegato ecc..) di altre mail precendenti/successive. (allego screen).

Inoltre avrei esigenza di avere le stesse etichette (sia di nome che di colore) su più macchine ma ho notato che è una funzionalità che forse ragiona in maniera locale e quindi etichettando una mail in un determinato modo su un PC non sempre avrò lo stesso risultato in sync su altro PC. Cè modo di ovviare a questa problematica o si può usare altro metodo o componente aggiuntivo?
creator: salvatore.nicosia1

title: Tietokoneen vaihto
content:
Hei,

kun vaihdoin tietokonetta en saanut aiempia sähköpostejani enää näkyviin. Onko tähän joku kikka, ettei kaikki postini häviä aina kun vaihdan konetta? Lisäksi edellisen koneen käyttäjän thunderbird sähköposti kummittelee aina välillä, enkä saa kirjattua sitä ulos, että käyttäjä olisin vain minä.
creator: jenny.uusitalo

title: With Thunderbird 128.3.1esr (64-bit) [snap] Ubuntu 24.04; Is there an alternate method to edit the SMTP Server information??
content:
Using Thunderbird 128.3.1esr (64-bit) [snap] Ubuntu 24.04 does not allow editing SMTP server.

Is there an alternate method to edit the SMTP Server information? If so, how?

When in Account Settings, pressing the Edit SMTP Server button generates the following errors in the Error Console:

XML Parsing Error: undefined entity Location: chrome://messenger/content/SmtpServerEdit.xhtml Line Number 155, Column 21: SmtpServerEdit.xhtml:155:21

TypeError: docEl.style is undefined SubDialog.sys.mjs:534:20
creator: mozilla414
